name: WP UniformJS
author: Matthew Woodard

sections.description:
If you are fed up with trying to style your form elements to look the same in all browsers, this is the plugin you need.

It implements the jQuery plugin UniformJS to any form element you choose. Includes 3 styles to choose from and you have the ability to make your own styles as well.

Works with:

  • Visual Form Builder
  • Contact Form 7
  • Ninja Forms
  • Gravity Forms
  • & More

Arbitrary section

A brief Markdown Example
sections.installation:
1. Upload uniform-js.zip to the /wp-content/plugins/ directory
  2. Activate the plugin through the ‘Plugins’ menu in WordPress
  3. Visit Settings > UniformJS, and enter your form selectors you want to have styled
sections.faq:
What is UniformJS?

UniformJS is a jQuery plugin that handles styling of form elements across browsers.
You can read the complete documentation here.

short_description: Adds Uniform JS (sexy forms with jQuery) to your wordpress forms.

screenshots.caption: This screen shot description corresponds to screenshot-1.(png|jpg|jpeg|gif). Note that the screenshot is taken from the /assets directory or the directory that contains the stable readme.txt (tags or trunk). Screenshots in the /assets directory take precedence. For example, /assets/screenshot-1.png would win over /tags/4.3/screenshot-1.png (or jpg, jpeg, gif).
